name: 專題討論（一）
restrict: ◎限本系(含雙主修)、輔系修習   ◎限博一修習 ◎課程不開放上修
goals: the course is designed to provide students with the latest progress in earth sciences via a series of lectures; there are also sessions for students to present their own research result which aim to help them improving presentation and science communication skills.
syllabus:
the graduate students' colloquium course is a series of weekly sessions on Tuesday afternoons.  it is designed to introduce students issues related to various contemporary research topics in earth sciences; it is also a venue for students to present their own esearch and practice academic communication skills.

tentative schedule --

weeks 01--07: invited talks\*\*  
week  08 -- midterm exam week  
weeks 09--12: invited talks\*\*  
weeks 13--15: student presentations of their own research  
week  16: final exam week / student feedback and reflection of the lecture series.

invited talks\*\*: talks related to astronomy, geology/geophyiscs, atmospheric science, & oceanography

methodologies.note: talks by invited speakers or students, followed by Q&A discussions, or panel discussions

prerequisite: ◎Exclusive for students within this department(including dual degree program) ◎Exclusive for students taking minor within this department    ◎Exclusive for first year of doctoral program ◎Unavailable for M.A. program students (M.A. program courses excepted) and B.A. program students.
